timeline.bodyText: just curious, how this relates to version update?
timeline.author: findepi

replies.bodyText:
The hashing function changed with qubole/rubix@7e797a5
With the new function, the paths in this test started mapping to the same worker node.
So I changed the path to get the test to pass :)
replies.author: raunaqmorarka

replies.bodyText:
How many "apparent nodes" do we have here?
can the new hashing function increase collusions % ?
replies.author: findepi

replies.bodyText: This test was meant to test that block locations are actually correctly propagated and not about hash function effectiveness.
replies.author: sopel39

replies.bodyText:
The new hashing function is expected to be better as it switches from guava's MD5+consistent hash to Metro hash + consistent hash from a library which has a better implementation of consistent hashing https://github.com/ishugaliy/allgood-consistent-hash.
Since there are only 2 nodes here, I don't think we can conclude much about quality of hash function here.
replies.author: raunaqmorarka
